member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.AmazonDLMRequest
member.summary: Base class for DLM operation requests.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateLifecyclePolicy operation. Creates a policy to manage the lifecycle of the specified AWS resources. You can create up to 100 lifecycle policies.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description of the lifecycle policy. The characters ^[0-9A-Za-z _-]+$ are supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest.ExecutionRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExecutionRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used to run the operations specified by the lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest.PolicyDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyDetails.
The configuration details of the lifecycle policy.
Target tags cannot be re-used across lifecycle policies.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
The desired activation state of the lifecycle policy after creation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateLifecyclePolicyResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateLifecyclePolicy operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateLifecyclePolicyResponse.PolicyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyId.
The identifier of the lifecycle policy.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateRule
member.summary: Specifies when to create snapshots of EBS volumes.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateRule.Interval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Interval.
The interval between snapshots. The supported values are 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateRule.IntervalUnit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IntervalUnit.
The interval unit.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateRule.Times
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Times.
The time, in UTC, to start the operation. The supported format is hh:mm.
The operation occurs within a one-hour window following the specified time.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.DeleteLifecyclePolicyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteLifecyclePolicy operation. Deletes the specified lifecycle policy and halts the automated operations that the policy specified.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.DeleteLifecyclePolicyRequest.PolicyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyId.
The identifier of the lifecycle policy.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.DeleteLifecyclePolicyResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteLifecyclePolicy operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePoliciesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetLifecyclePolicies operation. Gets summary information about all or the specified data lifecycle policies.
To get complete information about a policy, use GetLifecyclePolicy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePoliciesRequest.PolicyIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyIds.
The identifiers of the data lifecycle policies.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePoliciesRequest.ResourceTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceTypes.
The resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePoliciesRequest.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
The activation state.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePoliciesRequest.TagsToAdd
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TagsToAdd.
The tags to add to objects created by the policy.
Tags are strings in the format key=value.
These user-defined tags are added in addition to the AWS-added lifecycle tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePoliciesRequest.TargetTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetTags.
The target tag for a policy.
Tags are strings in the format key=value.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePoliciesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetLifecyclePolicies operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePoliciesResponse.Policies
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Policies.
Summary information about the lifecycle policies.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePolicyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetLifecyclePolicy operation. Gets detailed information about the specified lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePolicyRequest.PolicyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyId.
The identifier of the lifecycle policy.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePolicyResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetLifecyclePolicy operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.GetLifecyclePolicyResponse.Policy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Policy.
Detailed information about the lifecycle policy.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.LifecyclePolicy
member.summary: Detailed information about a lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.LifecyclePolicy.DateCreated
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DateCreated.
The local date and time when the lifecycle policy was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.LifecyclePolicy.DateModified
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DateModified.
The local date and time when the lifecycle policy was last modified.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.LifecyclePolicy.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description of the lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.LifecyclePolicy.ExecutionRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExecutionRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used to run the operations specified by the lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.LifecyclePolicy.PolicyDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyDetails.
The configuration of the lifecycle policy

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.LifecyclePolicy.PolicyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyId.
The identifier of the lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.LifecyclePolicy.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
The activation state of the lifecycle policy.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.LifecyclePolicySummary
member.summary: Summary information about a lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.LifecyclePolicySummary.Description

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.Parameters
member.summary: Optional parameters that can be added to the policy. The set of valid parameters depends on the combination of policyType and resourceType values.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Parameters.ExcludeBootVolume
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExcludeBootVolume.
When executing an EBS Snapshot Management Instance policy, execute all CreateSnapshots calls with the excludeBootVolume set to the supplied field. Defaults to false. Only valid for EBS Snapshot Management Instance policies.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.PolicyDetails
member.summary: Specifies the configuration of a lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.PolicyDetails.Parameters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Parameters.
A set of optional parameters that can be provided by the policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.PolicyDetails.PolicyType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyType.
This field determines the valid target resource types and actions a policy can manage. This field defaults to EBS_SNAPSHOT_MANAGEMENT if not present.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.PolicyDetails.ResourceTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceTypes.
The resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.PolicyDetails.Schedules
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Schedules.
The schedule of policy-defined actions.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.PolicyDetails.TargetTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetTags.
The single tag that identifies targeted resources for this policy.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.RetainRule
member.summary: Specifies the number of snapshots to keep for each EBS volume.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.RetainRule.Count
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Count.
The number of snapshots to keep for each volume, up to a maximum of 1000.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule
member.summary: Specifies a schedule.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.CopyTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CopyTags.
Copy all user-defined tags on a source volume to snapshots of the volume created by this policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.CreateRule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreateRule.
The create rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the schedule.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.RetainRule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RetainRule.
The retain rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.TagsToAdd
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TagsToAdd.
The tags to apply to policy-created resources. These user-defined tags are in addition to the AWS-added lifecycle tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Schedule.VariableTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VariableTags.
A collection of key/value pairs with values determined dynamically when the policy is executed. Keys may be any valid Amazon EC2 tag key. Values must be in one of the two following formats: $(instance-id) or $(timestamp). Variable tags are only valid for EBS Snapshot Management Instance policies.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.Tag
member.summary: Specifies a tag for a resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Tag.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
The tag key.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.Tag.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
The tag value.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.UpdateLifecyclePolicyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateLifecyclePolicy operation. Updates the specified lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.UpdateLifecyclePolicyRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description of the lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.UpdateLifecyclePolicyRequest.ExecutionRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExecutionRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used to run the operations specified by the lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.UpdateLifecyclePolicyRequest.PolicyDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyDetails.
The configuration of the lifecycle policy.
Target tags cannot be re-used across policies.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.UpdateLifecyclePolicyRequest.PolicyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyId.
The identifier of the lifecycle policy.

member.name: P:Amazon.DLM.Model.UpdateLifecyclePolicyRequest.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
The desired activation state of the lifecycle policy after creation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.Model.UpdateLifecyclePolicyResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateLifecyclePolicy operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.AmazonDLMClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing DLM
Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager
With Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager, you can manage the lifecycle of your AWS resources. You create lifecycle policies, which are used to automate operations on the specified resources.
Amazon DLM supports Amazon EBS volumes and snapshots. For information about using Amazon DLM with Amazon EBS, see Automating the Amazon EBS Snapshot Lifecycle in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.DLM.AmazonDLMClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonDLMClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.DLM.AmazonDLMClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonDLMClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.name: M:Amazon.DLM.AmazonDLMClient.#ctor(Amazon.DLM.AmazonDLMConfig)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonDLMClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The AmazonDLMClient Configuration Object

member.name: M:Amazon.DLM.AmazonDLMClient.CreateLifecyclePolicyAsync(Amazon.DLM.Model.CreateLifecyclePolicyRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a policy to manage the lifecycle of the specified AWS resources. You can create up to 100 lifecycle policies.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateLifecyclePolicy service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the CreateLifecyclePolicy service method, as returned by DLM.
member.exception: The service failed in an unexpected way.
Bad request. The request is missing required parameters or has invalid parameters.
The request failed because a limit was exceeded.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateLifecyclePolicy Operation

member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteLifecyclePolicy service method.

member.returns: The response from the DeleteLifecyclePolicy service method, as returned by DLM.

A requested resource was not found.

member.name: T:Amazon.DLM.IAmazonDLM
member.summary:
Interface for accessing DLM
Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager
With Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager, you can manage the lifecycle of your AWS resources. You create lifecycle policies, which are used to automate operations on the specified resources.
Amazon DLM supports Amazon EBS volumes and snapshots. For information about using Amazon DLM with Amazon EBS, see Automating the Amazon EBS Snapshot Lifecycle in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

member.summary: Creates a policy to manage the lifecycle of the specified AWS resources. You can create up to 100 lifecycle policies.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateLifecyclePolicy service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the CreateLifecyclePolicy service method, as returned by DLM.
member.exception: The service failed in an unexpected way.
Bad request. The request is missing required parameters or has invalid parameters.
The request failed because a limit was exceeded.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateLifecyclePolicy Operation
